Configuration.ChangeDescription: Various enhancements and fixes. Added support for new versions of Exchange-aware antivirus products. New configuration version is 2.10.0.1

Object.Name: EXRAP Customer Branding
Full Run
Exchange Risk Assessment
Operational Interview
Company Information
Have you provided this customer with a privacy statement?
What version or versions of Microsoft® Exchange Server are you running?
What Microsoft operating systems are you running on the servers that support your messaging infrastructure?
What Microsoft operating systems are you running on your clients?
What messaging clients are used in your environment?
How many different Exchange organizations are in the environment?
Do you have Certificate Authority or KMS in your environment?
Do you have any third-party add-ons in your environment (for example, a fax server)?
Customer Information
Does your operations staff know who their Premier Technical Account Manager (TAM) is and how to escalate issues to that person?
Is your staff familiar with your Premier support contract or how to find it?
Have all your operations staff had an Orientation and Planning session with your TAM in the last year?
Has your Technical Account Manager contacted you in the last month?
Operational Excellence
People
Do you have a dedicated Exchange engineering function?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellencePeopleDedicatedEngineeringFunction
Rule.Text: No dedicated Exchange engineering responsibility is assigned

Object.Name: Do you require base-level certification for your operations staff?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellencePeopleBaseLevelCertification
Rule.Text: No requirement for base level certification exists for operational staff

Object.Name: Where do you go for Microsoft Exchange Server help or to view Exchange documentation?
General
Does your IT organization utilize and adhere to an established operations framework such as Microsoft Operations Framework (MOF) or Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) principles?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceGeneralMOFITLPractices
Rule.Text: No adherence to established operational processes

Object.Name: In your environment, how often is load balancing of mailboxes across Exchange servers evaluated?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceGeneralMbxLoadBalancingQuarterly
Rule.Text: Less than quarterly load balancing occurs across Mailbox servers

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceGeneralMbxLoadBalancingNever
Rule.Text: No load balancing occurs across Mailbox servers

Object.Name: Do you have formal plans in place for non-routine failures, such as a natural disaster?

Rule.Name: fNoITSCMPlans
Rule.Text: No formal service continuity plans for non-routine failures exist

Object.Name: Do you track the per-mailbox cost of delivering the Messaging/Email service?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceGeneralCostAccounting
Rule.Text: No tracking of the per-mailbox cost of the Messaging service

Object.Name: Change, Configuration, and Release Management
Does every production Messaging/Email change get logged, no matter how small?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmLoggingAllChanges
Rule.Text: Process of logging and approving all Exchange production environment changes does not exist

Object.Name: Does the Messaging/Email team have an approval voice for other IT changes that might impact the Messaging/Email service?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmApprovalVoiceforChanges
Rule.Text: Messaging support staff do not have approval input into changes to the supporting services that affect Exchange

Object.Name: Do you have scheduled releases to keep the hardware, operating system, Microsoft Exchange Server application, and antivirus software on the Exchange servers up-to-date (for example, service packs)?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmScheduledReleases
Rule.Text: No scheduled releases to maintain the Exchange infrastructure occur

Object.Name: Do you apply Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Exchange Server updates (patches) to your servers more than once a year?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmPolicyToApplyPatchesMoreThanOnceAYear
Rule.Text: Windows and Exchange patches are not installed on a routine basis

Object.Name: Do you review and proactively apply security updates (patches) for both Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Exchange Server as they become available?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmReviewSecurityPatches
Rule.Text: Security patches not reviewed as they become available

Object.Name: Does it take more than a week to apply a critical security update to all servers?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmPolicyDurationToApplyPatches
Rule.Text: It takes more than a week to apply a critical security patch to all servers

Object.Name: Do you review and test updates before deployment?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmPolicyToTestPatches
Rule.Text: Patches are not tested before deployment to production

Object.Name: Do you have a lab that contains the same roles, code, and services you run in the production environment where you can test changes in the code and configuration?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmLabAndMatchesProduction
Rule.Text: A test lab that mimics the Exchange production environment does not exist

Object.Name: If one server is changed, are all other servers of the same type of role also changed?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmAllServersChangedIfOneChanges
Rule.Text: Changes are not applied to all servers of identical roles/types

Object.Name: Do you have detailed Microsoft Windows and Exchange build documents for your Exchange servers?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmDetailedWindowsAndExchangeBuildDocument
Rule.Text: Detailed Windows and Exchange Server build documents do not exist

Object.Name: Do you rely on MBSA versions 1.X or earlier for security patch management and scanning?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmUsesOldVersionsOfMbsa
Rule.Text: MBSA versions 1x or lower are insufficient for security patch management

Object.Name: Do you routinely run Microsoft Exchange Best Practice Analyzer against your environment and take action on the ExBPA results?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmUsesExbpa
Rule.Text: The Exchange Best Practice Analyzer is not routinely used

Object.Name: Are you alerted if an unapproved change is made to an Exchange server?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmChangeAudit
Rule.Text: No alerts for unapproved changes to Exchange servers occur

Object.Name: Do you have up-to-date asset information for your Exchange servers?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceCcrmAssetInfo
Rule.Text: Exchange Server asset information is not compiled

Object.Name: Incident and Problem Management
Do you have documented and communicated escalation matrices for Microsoft Exchange Server outages?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceImpEscalationMatricesForExchange
Rule.Text: No documented and communicated escalation matrices for Exchange outages exist

Object.Name: Do you have documented and communicated escalation matrices for services that Exchange is dependent upon?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceIpmEscalationMatricesforSupportingServices
Rule.Text: No documented and communicated escalation matrices for services that support Messaging/Email exist

Object.Name: Do you track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for reactive support, including Number of Incidents per period, Mean Time to Resolution, and Mean Time Between Failure? Do you also trend Microsoft Exchange Server outages?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceIpmSupportKPIs
Rule.Text: No tracking of Key Performance Indicators for reactive support occurs

Object.Name: Do you review each unplanned outage to look for improvement opportunities?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceIpmReviewUnplannedOutages
Rule.Text: Unplanned Exchange server outages are not reviewed for learning opportunities

Object.Name: Monitoring
Do you monitor your Microsoft Exchange Server environment?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceMonitoringNone
Rule.Text: Exchange server environment is not monitored

Rule.Name: fhasOperationalExcellenceMonitoring
Rule.Text: Customer does monitor their Exchange environment

Object.Name: What do you use to monitor Microsoft Exchange Server?
Do you run the Exchange MOM Management Pack?
Which of the following do you monitor?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceMonitoringInsufficient
Rule.Text: All required Exchange environment counters are not monitored

Object.Name: Is your Microsoft Exchange Server environment monitored 24 hours a day, 7 days a week?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceMonitoringTwentyFourBySeven
Rule.Text: Exchange environment is not monitored 24x7

Object.Name: Do you have automated notifications for monitored alerts?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceMonitoringAutomatedNotifications
Rule.Text: Automated alerts for monitored counters not implemented

Object.Name: Is there someone who is held accountable for responding to each alert?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceMonitoringSomeoneAccountableForAlerts
Rule.Text: No one is assigned accountability for responding to monitored alerts

Object.Name: Is there an action plan or operations guide for each alert, such as a troubleshooting guide?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceMonitoringfhasActionPlanForAlerts
Rule.Text: No action plan for responding to monitored alerts is in place

Object.Name: Service Level Management
Have you completed a Business Impact Analysis to determine the importance of the Messaging/Email service to your business and its relative importance versus other IT services in your organization?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaBusinessImpactAnalysis
Rule.Text: No Business Impact Analysis of the Messaging/Email service has been performed

Object.Name: Do you have defined service level agreements (SLAs) for the Messaging/Email service?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaDefined
Rule.Text: No defined Service Level Agreements (SLAs) exist for the Messaging/Email service

Object.Name: Do you have routine maintenance windows that do not count against your service levels?
Do you regularly review service level targets and your team's performance against those targets with the business units?
Do you measure availability of the Messaging/Email service?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaMeasureEmailServiceAvailability
Rule.Text: Service Level Availability of the Messaging/Email service is not measured

Object.Name: Is the measurement system automated?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaAutomatedMeasurmentSystem
Rule.Text: No automated method for measuring Messaging/Email availability exists

Object.Name: Do you publish the reports to Senior IT management?
Do you publish the reports to the customers and the business units?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaPublishToBuisnessUnits
Rule.Text: Messaging/Email availability reports are not published to business units

Object.Name: Do you have defined operating level agreements (OLAs) with the teams who own the services that support the Messaging/Email service?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaEmailServiceOla
Rule.Text: No defined Operating Level Agreements (OLAs) exist between IT groups who own the services that support the Messaging/Email service

Object.Name: Do you meet regularly as a team to review performance against SLAs and to define target action?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaTeamPerformanceReview
Rule.Text: Messaging team does not meet regularly to review and action performance against Sevice Level Agreements

Object.Name: Do you measure user, customer, and business unit satisfaction with the Messaging/Email service?

Rule.Name: fOperationalExcellenceSlaMeasureCustomerSatisfaction
Rule.Text: User satisfaction with the Messaging/Email service is not measured

Object.Name: Security
Exchange Platform
Do the new designs or core changes to the Exchange infrastructure go through a formal security review process (internal or external)?

Rule.Name: fSecurityExchangePlatformDesignReviewNone
Rule.Text: Changes to the Exchange infrastructure do not undergo formal security reviews

Rule.Name: fSecurityExchangePlatformDesignReviewAdHoc
Rule.Text: Changes to the Exchange infrastructure undergo Ad-hoc security reviews

Rule.Name: fSecurityExchangePlatformDesignReviewDefined
Rule.Text: Changes to the Exchange infrastructure undergo defined security reviews, but the results are not consistently enforced

Object.Name: What level of security and application logging, security auditing procedures, and processes does your organization have in the Microsoft Exchange Server environment?

Rule.Name: fSecurityExchangePlatformSecurityAuditingNone
Rule.Text: No process exists for security and application logging and auditing

Rule.Name: fSecurityExchangePlatformSecurityAuditingAdHoc
Rule.Text: The process for security and application logging and auditing is Ad-hoc

Object.Name: Are custom, Microsoft Windows group policies used to enforce security on Exchange servers?

Rule.Name: fhasNoCustomGroupPolicies
Rule.Text: Windows Group Policies not leveraged to enforce security settings to the messaging environment

Object.Name: What technologies does your organization use to protect the confidentiality and integrity of email data at the store and in transit?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeSecurityEMailStoreTransitProtectIPSECTLS
Rule.Text: Customer uses IPSEC/TLS to protect e-mail data

Object.Name: Messaging Hygiene
At what levels in the messaging infrastructure do you maintain antivirus protection controls?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneInsufficient
Rule.Query: not ((($fhasExchangeHygieneClientLevel or $fhasExchangeHygieneGateway) and $fhasExchangeHygieneStore) or (($fhasExchangeHygieneClientLevel or $fhasExchangeHygieneStore)and $fhasExchangeHygieneGateway) or (($fhasExchangeHygieneStore or $fhasExchangeHygieneGateway) and $fhasExchangeHygieneClientLevel))
Rule.Text: Email anti-virus protection is insufficient

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneGateway
Rule.Text: Customer implements anti-virus controls at the gateway level

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneGatewayMicrosoft
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the gateway level on a Microsoft platform

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneGatewayVendor
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the gateway level on a third-party platform

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneStore
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the Exchange server store level

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneServerStoreLevelVSAPI
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the Exchange server store level running a VSAPI-based solution

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneServerStoreLevelESE
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the Exchange server store level using ESE-based solution

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneServerStoreLevelMAPI
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the Exchange server store level using MAPI-based solution

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneServerFileSystemLevel
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the Exchange server file system level

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneClientLevel
Rule.Text: Anti-virus controls implemented at the e-mail client level

Object.Name: How does your organization use file-level, antivirus scanning on Exchange servers?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneFileAVNone
Rule.Text: The operating system on Exchange servers is not protected from viruses

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneFileAVDefault
Rule.Text: File level Anti-virus is not properly configured on the Exchange servers

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneFileAVStandard
Rule.Text: File level Anti-virus is not properly configured on the Exchange servers

Object.Name: At what level does your organization employ email client and desktop-level, antivirus software?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneClientNone
Rule.Text: No client level anti-virus scanning is implemented

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneClientAdHoc
Rule.Text: Virus protection at the client level is Ad-hoc

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneClientDefined
Rule.Text: Client level anti-virus has defined configuration, but the configuration is not consistently and proactively enforced

Object.Name: Are all outbound email messages from the Microsoft Exchange Server organization to the Internet being scanned for viruses?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneNoOutboundScanning
Rule.Text: All outbound e-mail messages are not scanned for viruses

Object.Name: At what level does your messaging environment have email attachment management and blocking controls implemented?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneAttachmentBlockingNone
Rule.Text: Attachment blocking policies do not exist in the Messaging environment

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneAttachmentBlockingAdhoc
Rule.Text: Attachment blocking controls implemented in the Messaging environment are insufficient and/or inconsistent

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneAttachmentBlockingClient
Rule.Text: Attachment blocking controls are enforced only at the client level

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneAttachmentBlockingGateway
Rule.Text: Attachment blocking controls are enforced only the gateway level

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneAttachmentBlockingMailbox
Rule.Text: Attachment blocking controls are enforced only at the mailbox level

Object.Name: At what level does your organization have a response process for an email virus outbreak, or a spam/email Denial of Service (DoS) attack?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneVirusSpamOutbreakResponseNone
Rule.Text: No Email virus outbreak response plan exists

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneVirusSpamOutbreakResponseAdhoc
Rule.Text: No messaging specific Email virus outbreak response plan exists, or it is Ad-hoc

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneVirusSpamOutbreakResponseDefined
Rule.Text: Email virus outbreak plan is defined, but it is not incorporated into the organization-wide risk management process

Object.Name: Do you have a user education program dedicated for virus-related threats?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneVirusNoUserEducation
Rule.Text: User education programs on company policies and procedures around virus protection do not exist

Object.Name: At what level does your organization have anti-spam controls implemented?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneSpamControlsNone
Rule.Text: Email anti-spam controls do not exist

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneSpamControlsAdhoc
Rule.Text: Email anti-spam controls are insufficient and/or inconsistent

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneSpamControlsRBLBased
Rule.Text: Email anti-spam controls are only block list based

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneSpamControlsMessageContentBased
Rule.Text: Email anti-spam controls are only content based

Object.Name: If you are using the Exchange Intelligent Message filter, how is it configured?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneIMFSetToArchive
Rule.Text: Intelligent Message Filter is set to archive.

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneIMFSetToNoAction
Rule.Text: Intelligent Message Filter is set to No Action.

Object.Name: If you archive, are you monitoring the archive or using a tool such as the IMF Archive Manager?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneIMFArchiveNoMonitor
Rule.Text: Intelligent Message Filter archive location is not currently monitored.

Object.Name: At what level does your messaging organization protect the identity of the owned email domains from spoofing and malicious impersonation through the Internet?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneDomainIdentityProtectNone
Rule.Text: The identity of Email domains are not protected

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneDomainIdentityProtectAdhoc
Rule.Text: The identity of Email domains are insufficiently protected

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneDomainIdentityProtectDefined
Rule.Text: The identity of Email domains are defined but are not consistently enforced for all inbound Email traffic for spoofing protection

Object.Name: At what level does your organization protect large or sensitive email distribution groups from unauthorized email submission and spamming?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneLargeDGProtectNone
Rule.Text: Large/sensitive distribution groups are not protected

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneLargeDGProtectAdhoc
Rule.Text: Large/sensitive distribution groups are protected, but this protection is not enforced by default

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneLargeDGProtectManaged
Rule.Text: Customer has a managed protection of large/sensitive distribution groups

Object.Name: Are you using a distribution group on your list of sender restrictions?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneUsingDGWithSenderRestrictions
Rule.Text: Customer is using DG with sender restrictions..

Object.Name: Does this distribution group contain nested distribution groups?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneUsingLargeDGProtectWithNested
Rule.Text: Large Distribution Groups use nested DGs to restrict sending

Object.Name: Have you implemented the changes to the restrictionMethod registry key from the Microsoft Knowledge Base article, 895407?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneUsingLargeDGProtectNotOptimized
Rule.Text: Large Distribution Group restrictions are not optimized with the fix from Knowledge Base article 895407

Object.Name: Does your Microsoft Exchange Server organization use distribution groups larger than 20,000 recipients to send to all mailboxes in the organization?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneUsingLargeDistributionGroups
Rule.Text: Large Distribution Groups are being used.

Object.Name: Do you have expansion servers set for these large distribution groups?

Rule.Name: fhasExchangeHygieneUsingLargeDGWithoutExpansionServers
Rule.Text: Large Expansion Groups do not have Expansion Servers set

Object.Name: Mailbox Access
Are users ever granted access to other user mailboxes for anything other than HR, security, or legal reasons?

Rule.Name: fhasMailboxAccessUsersGrantedAccess
Rule.Text: Users are granted access to other users' mailboxes

Object.Name: How often does an audit occur to verify that no users have access to another's individual mailbox?

Rule.Name: fhasMailboxAccessQuarterlyAudit
Rule.Text: Insufficient/infrequent mailbox access auditing occurs

Rule.Name: fhasMailboxAccessNoAudit
Rule.Text: Mailbox access is not audited

Object.Name: Are system administrators given permission to mailboxes in the environment?

Rule.Name: fhasMailboxAccessAdministratorDefaultRights
Rule.Text: Exchange Server Administrators have default access to mailboxes in the environment

Object.Name: Disaster Recovery
Planning
Do you have a documented disaster recovery plan?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryPlanningNone
Rule.Text: A documented disaster recovery plan does not exist

Object.Name: Is your disaster recovery plan documented thoroughly enough so that any member of your staff can perform a successful backup and restore when needed?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryPlanningInsufficientDocumentation
Rule.Text: A documented disaster recovery plan exists, but lacks sufficient detail

Object.Name: Do you practice or test your disaster recovery plans at least once a quarter?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningInsufficientFireDrills
Rule.Text: The disaster recovery plan is not routinely practiced (e.g. simulated fire drills)

Object.Name: Do your documents include detailed instructions for dealing with the following?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningMissingCoreScenarios
Rule.Text: The disaster recovery plan is missing common scenarios

Object.Name: Have you defined disaster recovery service level agreements for backup and recovery?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningNoServiceLevelAgreements
Rule.Text: Defined Service Level Agreements do not exist for backup and recovery processes

Object.Name: Are you able to meet your service level agreements?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningUnableToMeetSla
Rule.Text: Service Level Agreements are not met for disaster recovery

Object.Name: Do you plan or monitor for growth and also determine how it will affect your service level agreements?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningDoesNotMonitorGrowth
Rule.Text: The effect of growth and how it will impact Service Level Agreements is not planned for or monitored

Object.Name: Is there a process in place to verify that your backups are valid and restorable?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningDoesNotValidateBackups
Rule.Text: Backups are not verified to be valid or restorable

Object.Name: Is there a process in place to protect and verify the Exchange configuration data and dependencies such as the Active Directory, DNS, or the IIS Metabase?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningDoesNotProtectExchangeDependencies
Rule.Text: Exchange configuration data and/or dependencies are not backed up

Object.Name: Do you have extra disk/server hardware available for Exchange disaster recovery?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningExtraHardwareNone
Rule.Text: Spare hardware is not available for use during disaster recovery

Object.Name: Do you have a dedicated server for Exchange disaster recovery?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningDedicatedServerNone
Rule.Text: No dedicated servers are available for disaster recovery

Object.Name: Do you have additional disk space available on your Exchange servers for use by the Recovery Storage group?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningRecoveryStorageGroupDiskSpaceNone
Rule.Text: The Recovery Storage Group capability of Exchange Server 2003 is not utilized

Object.Name: Have you encountered corruption in the past 12 months?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningEncounteredCorruption
Rule.Text: Customer has encountered corruption in the last 12 months

Object.Name: When you encounter multiple corruption events, do you troubleshoot for the root cause?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterPlanningCorruptionAnalysisNone
Rule.Text: All instances of database corruption are not investigated down to root cause

Object.Name: Backup Schedule
Do you back up your Microsoft Exchange Server databases?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupDatabasesNone
Rule.Text: Exchange databases are not being backed up

Object.Name: Do you take daily full backups or copy backups?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupFullOnlineInsufficient
Rule.Text: Full online backups of all Exchange databases are not taken frequently enough

Object.Name: Do you use VSS or any other type of snapshot/clone technology?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupUsingVSS
Rule.Text: Customer is using VSS technology

Object.Name: Does the solution adhere to the requirements outlined in KB822896?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryVSSDoesNotAdhereKB822896
Rule.Text: Snapshot/clone technology does not adhere to Knowledge Base article 822896

Object.Name: Do you have an established backup window that does not conflict with OLD or OLM?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupWindowInSufficient
Rule.Text: No established backup windows exist for Exchange databases

Object.Name: Do backups run on Exchange servers during regular business hours?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupDuringBuisnessHours
Rule.Text: Exchange database backups occur during business hours

Object.Name: Do you monitor performance to ensure that users are not impacted by the additional load?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupDuringBuisnessHoursNotMonitored
Rule.Text: Performance is not monitored to ensure users are not impacted by backups running during business hours

Object.Name: How long, on average, does it take to back up your largest mailbox database?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMailboxBackupTimeSeven
Rule.Text: Mailbox backups take seven or more hours to complete

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMailboxBackupTimeTwelve
Rule.Text: Mailbox backups take twelve or more hours to complete

Object.Name: How long, on average, does it take to back up your largest public folder database?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryPublicFolderBackupTimeSeven
Rule.Text: Public folder database backups take seven or more hours to complete

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryPublicFolderBackupTimeTwelve
Rule.Text: Public folder database backups take twelve or more hours to complete

Object.Name: How long do you expect it to take to restore a single mailbox database?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMailboxRestoreTimeSeven
Rule.Text: Mailbox restore process takes seven or more hours to complete

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMailboxRestoreTimeTwelve
Rule.Text: Mailbox restore process takes twelve or more hours to complete

Object.Name: How long do you expect it to take to restore a single public folder database?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryPublicFolderRestoreTimeSeven
Rule.Text: Public folder restore process takes seven or more hours to complete

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryPublicFolderRestoreTimeTwelve
Rule.Text: Public folder restore process takes twelve or more hours to complete

Object.Name: Do you use tape as a backup media?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryUsesTape
Rule.Text: Customer uses tape as a backup media

Object.Name: Do you have a tape rotation scheme?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryTapeRotationNone
Rule.Text: Tape is used as a backup media, but no tape rotation scheme exists

Object.Name: Do you have a plan for retiring tapes that adheres to manufacturer recommendations?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupTapeLifeCycleInsufficient
Rule.Text: Tape retirement plans do not adhere to manufacturer's recommendations

Object.Name: Do you have an OLA with your backup team to guarantee tape and device availability in the event of a disaster?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryNoBackupTeamOLA
Rule.Text: No OLA exists with the backup team to guarantee tape and device availability in the event of a disaster

Object.Name: Are you in an industry that is mandated to store this data offsite?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryOffsiteRequirment
Rule.Text: Customer has offsite backup media requirements

Object.Name: Do you adhere to these requirements by moving tapes or other backup media offsite?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryBackupMediaNotStoredOffsite
Rule.Text: Industry-mandated offsite storage requirements are not met

Object.Name: Maintenance
Does Exchange online maintenance (OLM) complete at least once a week?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMaintenanceOLMInsufficient
Rule.Text: Exchange online maintenance does not complete at least once a week

Object.Name: Does Exchange online defragmentation (OLD) complete at least twice a month on your Microsoft Exchange Server databases?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMaintenanceOLDInsufficient
Rule.Text: Exchange online defragmentation does not complete at least twice per month

Object.Name: Do you find it necessary to run eseutil /p (repair) more than once every six months?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMaintenanceRepairToFrequent
Rule.Text: Eseutil/p (repair) is run too often

Object.Name: Do you find it necessary to run eseutil /g (integrity check) more than once every six months?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMaintenanceIntegrityCheckToFrequent
Rule.Text: Eseutil/g (integrity) is run too often

Object.Name: Do you find it necessary to run eseutil /d (offline defragmentation) more than once every six months?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMaintenanceOfflineDefragToFrequent
Rule.Text: Eseutil/d (offline defragmentation) is run too often

Object.Name: Do you find it necessary to run isinteg more than once every six months?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryMaintenanceIsintegToFrequent
Rule.Text: Isinteg is run too often

Object.Name: Training
Does your staff know how to accomplish or handle the following?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryTrainingCanHandleCommonFailures
Rule.Text: Staff is not trained to handle common database failures

Object.Name: Does your staff understand the following?

Rule.Name: fhasDisasterRecoveryTrainingUnderstandsArchitecture
Rule.Text: Staff lacks sufficient training in common database concepts

Object.Name: High Availability
Storage
Do you know what the read/write response times are during peak periods on the disks that support Microsoft Exchange Server?

Rule.Name: fhasnoPolicyToMeasurePeakReadWriteResponseTimes
Rule.Text: Peak read/response times on the disks supporting Exchange are not known

Object.Name: What items do you consider when provisioning storage for Microsoft Exchange Server?

Rule.Name: fhasNoPerformanceProvisioning
Rule.Text: Performance in I/O per second is not considered when provisioning storage for Exchange

Object.Name: Are you currently using an email archiving product or planning to evaluate one?
What storage vendors are you currently using or planning to deploy?
What other storage vendors are you using?
Are you using shared SAN storage for Exchange?

Rule.Name: fHighAvailabilityUsingSharedSANStorage
Rule.Text: Customer is using shared SAN storage

Object.Name: Do you support a variety of business applications in a shared storage controller (array/frame) or do you dedicate controllers?

Rule.Name: fHighAvailabilityUsingSharedControllers and ($fHighAvailabilityUsingSharedSANStorage)
Rule.Text: A shared storage controller is used to support a variety of business applications

Object.Name: Do you dedicate disk drive resources for Exchange performance?

Rule.Name: fhasSharedAllocationConfiguration
Rule.Text: Disk drive resources are not dedicated for Exchange performance

Object.Name: Is your storage environment supported by Microsoft Hardware Compatibility List HCL?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityStorageVendorSupport
Rule.Text: The storage environment in use is not on the certified Microsoft Hardware Compatibility List

Object.Name: Is there a site-level disaster plan that uses data movement technology?
If so, what type of technology is being used?
If so, what update method is being used?
Clustering
Have you deployed a Microsoft MSCS clustered Exchange configuration?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityClusteringDeployed
Rule.Text: Microsoft Exchange clustering implemented

Object.Name: What type of clusters have you deployed?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityTwoNodeActiveActive
Rule.Text: Microsoft Exchange Active/Active clustering is implemented

Object.Name: Do you have more than 1,900 mailboxes per active instance?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityMoreThan1900MbxPerActiveInstance
Rule.Text: More than 1900 mailboxes exist per active instance

Object.Name: Do you use the default cluster resource parameters (Affect the Group, Restart)?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityClusteringUsingDefaultResourceParameters
Rule.Text: Default Microsoft cluster resource parameters are in use

Object.Name: If the Affect the Group option is enabled, do you adjust the Exchange group Failover Policy?

Rule.Name: fhasNoAdjustFailoverAffectGroupEnabled
Rule.Text: Affect the Group option is enabled and the Exchange Group Failover Policy has not been adjusted

Object.Name: Is the Affect the Group option disabled on non-critical resources such as MSDTC and MSSearch?

Rule.Name: fhasAffectGroupDisabledCriticalResources
Rule.Text: Affect the Group option is enabled for non-critical resources

Object.Name: Do you have an effective monitoring system to detect resource state changes?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityEffectiveEventManagement
Rule.Text: No effective event monitoring system to detect resource state changes exists

Object.Name: Do you disable the event log replication service?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityDisabledEventLogReplication
Rule.Text: Event log replication is not disabled

Object.Name: Do you have a public and an internal network set up to support each cluster?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityPublicAndInternalNetworks
Rule.Text: Separate Public and Internal networks are not set up to support each cluster

Object.Name: Is the internal network set to support only internal cluster communications?

Rule.Name: fhasNetworkSupportsOnlyInternalCluster
Rule.Text: The internal network is not set to support only internal cluster communications

Object.Name: Is the public network set to support all communications?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicInternalForEachCluster
Rule.Text: The public network is not set to support all cluster communications

Object.Name: Is the internal network set to have a higher priority?

Rule.Name: fhasNotSetInternalNetworkPriority
Rule.Text: The internal network is not set to have a higher priority

Object.Name: Do you use teamed network adapters?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityTeamedNetworkAdapters
Rule.Text: NIC Teaming in use

Object.Name: Do you team the public-facing NICS?
Do you team the internal NICS?

Rule.Name: fhasInternalNICTeaming
Rule.Text: Internal Network Interface Cards are teamed

Object.Name: Do you use a Load Balanced Team (LBP)?
Do you set NIC negotiation to match switch port configuration such as Auto and 100MB/Full Duplex?

Rule.Name: fhasnotSetNICNegotiationtoMatchSwitchPort
Rule.Text: Network Interface Card negotiation is not set to match switch port configuration

Object.Name: Are there any sustained indications of 1022 or 1023 events in the SYSTEM event log?

Rule.Name: fhas1022or1023Events
Rule.Text: The System event log indicates the presence of sustained 1022 or 1023 errors

Object.Name: Are the public-facing adapters bound to have the highest priority in Advanced Settings within Network Connections on all nodes?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicAdapterNotHighestPriority
Rule.Text: Public-facing adapters are not bound at highest priority within the Windows networking

Object.Name: Does it take longer then five minutes to move an Exchange resource group between nodes?

Rule.Name: fhasHighAvailabilityLongerThanFiveMinuteManualFailOver
Rule.Text: Cluster resource groups take more than five minutes to fail over

Object.Name: Is your cluster configuration listed within the Microsoft Windows Server Catalog as a cluster solution?

Rule.Name: fhasClusterNotListedWSC
Rule.Text: Cluster configuration is not listed within the Windows Server Catalog

Object.Name: Public Folders
Management
How do you control the size of individual folders?

Rule.Name: fhasNoPublicFolderSizeControl
Rule.Text: Public Folder size is not controlled

Object.Name: Do you centrally control replica placement?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicFolderReplicaPlacementControlNone
Rule.Text: Public Folder replica placement is not controlled

Object.Name: Is the public folder permission and creation management centralized?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicFolderPolicyCentralizedNone
Rule.Text: Public Folder permission and management is not centralized

Object.Name: Do you have workflow or other applications that rely on public folders?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicFolderWorkFlowDependency
Rule.Text: Public folders contain workflow

Object.Name: Do you have business-critical data stored in public folders?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicFolderBusinessCriticalData
Rule.Text: Business critical data contained within Public Folders

Object.Name: Do you have more than 250 subfolders per folder?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicFolderToManySubFolders
Rule.Text: The maximum number of subfolders per folder exceeds 250

Object.Name: Do you have more than 10,000 messages per folder, not including system folders?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicFolderToManyMessages
Rule.Text: The maximum number of messages per folder exceeds 10,000

Object.Name: Do you have more that 10,000 mailboxes pointed to a single public folder database?

Rule.Name: fhasPublicFolderToManyMailboxs
Rule.Text: More than 10,000 users per public store are in use

Object.Name: Do you have servers dedicated solely to public folders?

Rule.Name: fPublicFolderDedicated
Rule.Text: Dedicated public folder servers do not exist

Object.Name: Have you ever had a public folder replication storm?

Rule.Name: fPublicFodersHasReplicationStorms
Rule.Text: Public folder replication storm has happened in the past

Object.Name: When was the last replication storm?

Rule.Name: fPublicFolderReplicationStorm3mon
Rule.Text: A replication storm has occurred within the last three months

Rule.Name: fPublicFolderReplicationStorm3to6mon
Rule.Text: A replication storm has occurred within the last six months

Rule.Name: fPublicFolderReplicationStormMore6mon
Rule.Text: A replication storm has occurred greater than six months ago

Object.Name: Are you currently consolidating or planning to consolidate your public folders?

Rule.Name: fPublicFodersPlanningConsolidation
Rule.Text: Exchange Consolidation planning in progress

Object.Name: Will you be running E2K3 Sp1 or later on your servers and Microsoft Outlook 2003 cached-mode on your clients when you do it?

Rule.Name: fPublicFolderConsolidatePreE2K3SP1
Rule.Text: During public folder consolidation, Exchange Server 2003 SP1 or later with Outlook 2003 cached-mode is not deployed

Object.Name: Do you batch the replica changes?

Rule.Name: fPublicFolderConsolidateNoBatching
Rule.Text: During public folder consolidation, replica changes are not batched

Object.Name: Do you perform the content migrations during the business day?

Rule.Name: fPublicFolderConsolidateDuringDay
Rule.Text: During public folder consolidation, content migrations are performed during the business day

Object.Name: Do you have content stored in public folders that does not require replication?
Do you have content stored in public folders that has to be held for legal and regulatory retention?
Transport and Internet Mail
Configuration
Is message tracking enabled on all the Exchange servers that route mail?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationMessageTrackingEnabled
Rule.Text: Message tracking is not enabled on all Exchange servers

Object.Name: Have you configured DNS records for all outbound SMTP so Internet domains can perform reverse resolution on domains that you are responsible for?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationReverseDnsResolution
Rule.Text: Outbound SMTP servers need DNS records to allow for reverse resolution

Object.Name: Do Internet-facing email gateways have SMTP closed for relay from the Internet?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationSmtpClosedRelayAnonymous
Rule.Text: Internet-facing SMTP gateways are not closed for relay from the Internet

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationSmtpClosedRelayNone
Rule.Text: One or more Internet-facing SMTP gateways is open for anonymous relay

Object.Name: Is unrestricted, anonymous SMTP access allowed to the internal messaging servers?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationInternalAnonymousSmtp
Rule.Text: Access to internal SMTP servers is not restricted

Object.Name: What measures are employed to establish fault tolerance and business continuity for the organization's Internet email flow?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationGatewayRedundancy
Rule.Text: Internet Email infrastructure does not have redundancy and/or business continuity features

Object.Name: Do you have your Internet-facing Exchange SMTP servers configured to filter recipients who are not in the directory?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationFilterNonDirectoryRecipients
Rule.Text: SMTP servers are configured to filter recipients who are not in the directory

Object.Name: Have you configured the registry to use the tarpitTime feature, from the Microsoft Knowledge Base article 842851, to delay response time?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationTarpPitTimeFeature
Rule.Text: Exchange servers performing recipient filtering should have the tarpitTime feature enabled per Knowledge Base article 842851

Object.Name: Is your Microsoft Exchange Server environment set up to share email domains?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationShareEmailDomains
Rule.Text: Customer is sharing email domains

Object.Name: Is your Exchange organization the final link for mail destined for the domain that is shared?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailConfigurationFinalDestination
Rule.Text: The Exchange organization is set up to be the final destination for a shared Email domain

Object.Name: Does your staff know how to do the following?
Winroute
Were you able to run Winroute?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailWinrouteToolWasRun
Rule.Text: Engineer was able to run winroute

Object.Name: Are there any servers that are not connected to the routing group masters?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailWinrouteNotConnectedToMaster
Rule.Text: Servers are not connected to the routing group master

Object.Name: Are they front-end servers?
Are they back-end or routing servers?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailWinrouteBackendServer
Rule.Text: Exchange back-end or routing group servers appear disconnected from the routing group master

Object.Name: Does the Winroute output contain a [Objects not found in DS] or [Routing groups not found in DS] container that is not the result of inadequate permissions at the time Winroute was run?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailWinrouteObjectsNotFoundInDs
Rule.Text: Winroute output contains a [Objects not found in DS] or [Routing groups not found in DS]

Object.Name: Does that container hold any objects that were not actually deleted?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailWinrouteObjectsNotDeleted
Rule.Text: The DS container includes Winroute objects that have not been deleted

Object.Name: Has remonitor been run in inject mode to clean up the entries in this container?

Rule.Name: fTransportAndInternetMailWinrouteRemonitorInjectMode
Rule.Text: The Winroute packet has not been cleaned using REMonitor in inject mode

Object.Name: Mobile Messaging
What mobile messaging services are provided to your users over the Internet?

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingServiceOWA
Rule.Text: OWA service being provided over the Internet

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingServicesProvided
Rule.Text: Exchange mobile messaging services being provided over the Internet

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingServiceOMA
Rule.Text: OMA service being provided over the Internet

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingServiceEAS
Rule.Text: EAS service being provided over the Internet

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingServiceRPC
Rule.Query: ($.)='Microsoft Outlook access using Remote Procedure Calls (RPC) over the Internet'
Rule.Text: Outlook MAPI/RPC service being provided over the Internet

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingServiceRPCHTTP
Rule.Query: ($.)='Microsoft Outlook access using RPC/HTTP over the internet'
Rule.Text: Outlook RPC/HTTP service being provided over the Internet

Object.Name: What types of network security controls are implemented for your Internet-facing Exchange mobile messaging infrastructure?

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingNetworkSecurityRouterACLs
Rule.Text: Router ACL's and NAT for Exchange Front End publishing in use

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingNetworkSecurityFEinDMZ
Rule.Text: Exchange Front End servers in the DMZ environment

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingNetworkSecurityAppProxyAndDMZ
Rule.Text: Application proxy servers are in use, but the Exchange front-end servers are located in the perimeter network

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingNetworkSecurityNOAppProxy
Rule.Text: No use of application-level proxying or filtering controls

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingNetworkSecurityNone
Rule.Text: No use of network-level filtering and translation security controls

Object.Name: At what level is encryption implemented for mobile messaging clients?

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingEncryptionNone
Rule.Text: Encryption for mobile messaging clients coming from the Internet is not implemented

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingEncryptionClientProxy
Rule.Text: Encryption for mobile messaging connections is not maintained between the Proxy infrastructure and Exchange front-end servers

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingEncryptionClientFrontEnd
Rule.Text: Mobile messaging encryption is maintained from the client through the front-end server

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingEncryptionClientBackEnd
Rule.Text: Mobile messaging encryption maintained from the client through the back-end server

Object.Name: Do you have redundancy and fault tolerance in your Exchange front-end infrastructure?

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingNoFrontEndRedundancy
Rule.Text: No front-end redundancy or fault tolerance exists

Object.Name: What is the redundancy for the Exchange front-end infrastructure based on?
How are internal mobile messaging clients, such as internal Microsoft Outlook Web Access or EAS, accessing the environment?

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingInternalClientsNone
Rule.Text: No internal mobile messaging clients

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingInternalClientsBackEnd
Rule.Text: Internal mobile messaging clients connect directly to Exchange back-end servers

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingInternalClientsFrontEndEncouraged
Rule.Text: Internal mobile clients are encouraged, but not required to use Exchange front-end servers

Rule.Name: fhasMobileMessagingInternalClientsFrontEndRequired
Rule.Text: All internal mobile clients are required to use Front End servers

Object.Name: Environmental Dependencies
Active Directory (AD)
Do you have global catalog servers available in every Active Directory® site that hosts an Exchange server?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesActiveDirectorySiteGCInEverySiteNone
Rule.Text: Not all Active Directory sites hosting Exchange servers have Global Catalog servers

Object.Name: Do you ensure that the PDC Emulator FSMO role-holder is avoided by Exchange either by locating it in an Active Directory site that is not used for Exchange or by using the MinUserDc registry value?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesActiveDirectorySitePDCFSMO
Rule.Text: PDC FSMO role-holder is available for use by Exchange

Object.Name: Do you have your Exchange servers in a separate Active Directory site with dedicated global catalog servers?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesActiveDirectorySiteDedicatedGCNone
Rule.Text: A dedicated Active Directory Site with Global Catalogs is not implemented for Exchange

Object.Name: Does your IT organization employ tools to verify that AD replication is succeeding across all domain controllers in the forest?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesActiveDirectoryNoAdReplicationTools
Rule.Text: Active Directory replication success is not verified across all domain controllers

Object.Name: Does your IT organization employ tools to verify that DNS records are properly registered by all domain controllers in the forest?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesActiveDirectoryNoAdDNSTools
Rule.Text: Successful DNS record registration by all domain controllers in the forest is not verified

Object.Name: In the past 12 months how many problems have you experienced with your Microsoft Exchange Server environment that were caused by issues with Active Directory?
Was the root cause diagnosed and fixed?
Domain Name System (DNS)
Are dynamic updates enabled for SRV, A, and CNAME record types throughout the AD forest?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesDNSInSufficient
Rule.Text: Dynamic updates are not enabled for all necessary DNS record types

Object.Name: Do you monitor the availability of all A records for all SMTP servers?
Network
Do you maintain a complete and up-to-date diagram of your network that shows bandwidth, routing, and user counts at each physical location?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesNetworkDiagramNone
Rule.Text: Current network diagrams are not maintained

Object.Name: Do you discuss bandwidth needs with your networking team prior to implementing a new technology or feature?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesNetworkBandwithReviewNone
Rule.Text: Network bandwidth reviews are not conducted prior to new hardware or technology deployments

Object.Name: Is the messaging team notified of network issues and outages within 15 minutes?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesNetworkOutageNotificationsNone
Rule.Text: Network outage notifications are not timely

Object.Name: How frequently does your company experience a networking issue or outage that affects Microsoft Exchange Server?

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesNetworkOutagesDaily
Rule.Text: Daily network outages are experienced

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesNetworkOutagesMonthly
Rule.Text: Monthly network outages are experienced

Rule.Name: fhasEnviromentalDependenciesNetworkOutagesQuarterly
Rule.Text: Quarterly network outages are experienced
